segments.text: I notice the little boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for a cookie, but neither of them seems to care about how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless they’re being, all for a few cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying dishes has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall, and the girl is just going to stand there and watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and just gotten lucky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is already tilted, and the boy is stretching so far—it’s like he’s daring gravity to take him down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should step in and stop this before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But they’re so focused on those cookies, they wouldn’t even hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR
